(d. 979) [Ch. of E.] Monk and spiritual teacher. Born in Beth ʿEdraye, near Mosul , he became a monk of the Monastery of Rabban Hormizd , but subsequently moved to the monastery of Abraham, of Beth Ṣayyare (in the ʿAmadiyya region, N. Iraq). His Life was written by his disciple Yoḥannan bar Kaldun; this not only incorporates much of his spiritual teaching (in chapter 8), but it also gives a detailed picture of monastic life of the time. Sources J.-B.  Chabot, ‘Vie du moine Rabban Youssef Bousnaya écrite par son disciple Jean bar Kaldoun’, ROC 2 (1897), 357–405; 3 (1898), 77–121, 168–90, 292–327, 458–80; 4 (1899), 380–415; 5 (1900), 118–43, 182–200.
